column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////Onto the meat of the matter
column2: I wouldn't say anything on the menu truly "wow"ed me. The first time around
column5: but I didn't notice anything special about it that I couldn't get for cheaper somewhere else. The second time around
column9: and cheese--it was already prepared and next to all the pastries. For only about four inches of sandwich
column10: I paid six dollars. My friends got the biscuits and gravy the first time around and said that was wonderful
column11: but a bit expensive. That being said
column12: the portions are a fair size. Maybe I just didn't get the right things?
